TopicTitle: Design a new lineup of stock vehicles!

Articles.Content:
Hello!

So we all know the basic ships that come loaded with every save. The Kerbal X, Two stage lander, Aeris 3a, etc. But when you take a closer look, you realize that... these crafts are fairly useless. 

The Kerbal X has a pod with landing legs, but can't make it back from the mun. The Stearwing d-45 can only make orbit with excellent piloting, but it's obviously designed to be an ssto. The Kerbal 2.... What even is the Kerbal 2? The super heavy lander is not very well built, and wastes a lot of delta v. And the list goes on.

**CHALLENGE**

Your job is to build a new stock vehicle lineup to fill the basic niches (Small rocket, lander, larger rocket, various aircraft, ssto, etc.) that will teach new players good strategies and practices for building ships.

**RULES**

- No excessive clipping. You can decide if your craft(s) violate this rule.

- Stock parts only. Informational plugins are fine. In fact, Kerbal Engineer is recommended to see delta v of your craft.

- No debug menu *\*cough*\* Kaboom! *\*cough\**

**LEADERBOARDS**

**SPH**

JLtheGrunger, Pelican (Aeris 3a Light Jet)

**VAB**

GoSlash27, Rockomax Katapult (2.5m medium launcher)

Bev7787, Navigator Probe Launch Kit (1.25m launcher w/ Probe)

Red Iron Crown, Day Tripper (Mun and Minmus lander w/ launcher)

JLtheGrunger, Proton K (3.75m Heavy Launcher)

Good luck, and happy building!

SmallFatFetus

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-25T00:35:13Z" title="07/25/2015 12:35  AM" data-short="8 yr">July 25, 2015</time> by SmallFatFetus**
You never said we couldn't use the debug menu

You just had to, didn't you. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Seriously though, that's a given with challenges. But I did add it in the rules just for you.

Yeah, what the heck.

![20tonnes_zpsgc7uceyt.jpg](http://i52.photobucket.com/albums/g13/GoSlash27/20tonnes_zpsgc7uceyt.jpg)

 I'll call this the "RockoMax Katapult". A simple, rugged, dirt-cheap 2-stager designed to huck a 20 tonne payload into LKO. 

[Download here](http://wikisend.com/download/699328/20tLifter.craft)

Best,

-Slashy

I've got a small satellite ship Note: Normal design is stock. I just realised this modified one has a nova punch part. I'll post the stock version later 

here's the pic. Launcher is cheap, partially reusable and carries a satellite with enough delta v to orbit duna![KqmV7lC.png](http://imgur.com/KqmV7lC.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-12T22:25:58Z" title="07/12/2015 10:25  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 12, 2015</time> by Bev7787**

A simple aircraft, it was supposed to be similar to the Aeris-3a in concept, but ended up looking quite different ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif)

Here's the craft file: [http://kerbalx.com/JLtheGrunger/Pelican-1](http://kerbalx.com/JLtheGrunger/Pelican-1)

![xo7KdcS.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/xo7KdcS.png?1)

![XqNGYsR.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/XqNGYsR.png?1)

I have a basic, easy to fly rocket for practicing missions to the Mun or Minmus, the DayTripper ([craft file](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/DayTripper/DayTripper.craft)).

> ![screenshot629.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/DayTripper/screenshot629.png)

> 
> 1. T, Z, Space
> 
> 2. At 100m/s press and hold D until SRBs run out.
> 
> 3. Stage and set SAS to prograde.
> 
> 4. Burn until Ap is 75km.
> 
> 5. At 70km altitude stage fairings.
> 
> 6. At 5 seconds to Ap press Z and burn until Pe is 75km.
> 
> ![screenshot645.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/DayTripper/screenshot645.png)

Arrives in orbit with enough dV in the core stage to transfer to the Mun (or Minmus if done efficiently), and has a small two-stage lander with comfortable dV margins for landing and return from either moon.

> ![screenshot647.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/DayTripper/screenshot647.png)
> ![screenshot648.png](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/61004449/KSP/1.0.4/DayTripper/screenshot648.png)

The lander has some minor clipping to fit within the fairing neatly, not sure if it's enough to disqualify it.

I also made a Heavy Launcher, similar in shape to the Proton, capable of carrying up to 80 tons into LKO (the craft file has a 80tons dummy payload btw). 

![775vzjQ.png](http://i.imgur.com/775vzjQ.png)

![4GdEDl1.png](http://i.imgur.com/4GdEDl1.png)

Craft file here: [http://kerbalx.com/JLtheGrunger/PROTON-inspired-heavy-launcher](http://kerbalx.com/JLtheGrunger/PROTON-inspired-heavy-launcher)
